title: ion-segment
body: Segments display a group of related buttons, sometimes known as segmented controls, in a horizontal row. They can be displayed inside of a toolbar or the main content.

Their functionality is similar to tabs, where selecting one will deselect all others. Segments are useful for toggling between different views inside of the content. Tabs should be used instead of a segment when clicking on a control should navigate between pages.

Segments are not scrollable by default. Each segment button has a fixed width, and the width is determined by dividing the number of segment buttons by the screen width. This ensures that each segment button can be displayed on the screen without having to scroll. As a result, some segment buttons with longer labels may get cut off. To avoid this we recommend either using a shorter label or switching to a scrollable segment by setting the
. This will cause the segment to scroll horizontally, but will allow each segment button to have a variable width.

javascript: // Listen for ionChange on all segments

props.name: color
props.docs: The color to use from your application's color palette. Default options are: "primary", "secondary", "tertiary", "success", "warning", "danger", "light", "medium", and "dark". For more information on colors, see theming.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If true, the user cannot interact with the segment.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: scrollable
props.docs: If true, the segment buttons will overflow and the user can swipe to see them. In addition, this will disable the gesture to drag the indicator between the buttons in order to swipe to see hidden buttons.

events.docs:
Emitted when the value property has changed and any
dragging pointer has been released from `ion-segment`.
